When I run HelloWorld with output to both a file at "." and the console, I get the following in my 
console:
[Invalid file specified for console output: .]
Hello World

Looking at the code I don't see how an invalid file could cause output to be lost if the user has opted to 
use the console as well as a file. Do you have a test case for this?

Here at home I am not losing all output...but I still can get the exception.
Set the file to append...sorry for missing that detail.
The exception is normal. It's just a log entry of questionable value. Easy to stop logging that.
